result.execSummary:
The defendant James M Vaughn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. James M Vaughn is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • James M Vaughn was found guilty of Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
Huber release for employment only
Consecutive to: any other sentence, with credit for 7 days served.

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable mandatory surcharges, costs, fees, assessments by the end of supervision period or any remaining balance shall convert to civil judgment. Pay all supervision fees.

Obtain/maintain full time employment or full time school and part time employment.
Obtain high school diploma, GED, or HSED.

No illegal drugs or association with drug community (drug users/dealers or drug houses).
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with Telly Hunt, Tamel Manns, Jhatara Clark, Tatiana Robinson, and Rudell Wilder.
No driving without a valid license.

Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
Cooperate with any and all rules set forth by the probation agent.
Particiapte in Thinking for a Change Program or a Cognitive Thinking Program.
The Court grants expungement CONTINGENT upon successful completion of ALL conditions of probation (including financial obligations) by the end of the probation period.
Obtain AODA assessment and successfully complete follow-up treatment if deemed necessary.

DOC notice of case status change.
Probation/Extended Supervision status:  
( X  ) Revoked             (  ) Discharged
(  ) Discharge Certificate Filed.
Effective date:  08-15-2014            Initials:  AAC

Defendant James M Vaughn in court with Attorney Christian T Eichenlaub.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds. 

Amended Information filed on today.  Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of a copy of the Amended Information, waived its reading and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant.
  
Charges amended as follows:

Count 1:  Carrying a Concealed Weapon, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 941.23(2), a Class A Misdemeanor

Count 2:  Obstructing/Resisting an Officer, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 946.41(1), a Class A Misdemeanor
AMENDED INFORMATION, FILED.
JusticePoint report, received and filed.

14RM020657  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04-16-14
CONDITIONS PREVIOUSLY ORDERED:  TURN OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant James M Vaughn in court.  Attorney Christian T Eichenlaub appears via telephone.  Benjamin A Wesson appears for the State of Wisconsin on behalf of Benjamin Lindsay.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Matter before the Court to address violation report.  The Court reviews JusticePoint report with the parties.  Bail argument of the parties heard.  On motion of the state, the Court ordered cash bail in the amount of $75.00 cash with same bail conditions as previously ordered.  Case remains set for Plea and Sentencing on 4-22-14 at 1:30 p.m. before Branch 21.

VIOLATION Report (postive drug test), received and filed.
*parties notified*

Defendant James M Vaughn in court with Attorney Christian T Eichenlaub.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Matter set for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.  Parties advised that Branch 21 is presiding over a jury trial in an unrelated matter and unable to hear this matter; case adjourned.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 22, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint report, received and filed.

VIOLATION Report, received and filed.
*parties notified*

Defendant James M Vaughn in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Report, reviewed and filed.
Scheduling conference scheduled for 03-19-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant James M Vaughn in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Ben Wesson, appearing for Benjamin Lindsay, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.

Court admonishes defendant that he is to cooperate with all conditions of bail; further he is to contact JusticePoint to verify his in-person appointments and his telephone contact appointments.
Clerk:  jms

JusticePoint Pretrial Report dated March 13, 2014 received and filed.
Clerk:  jms

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant James M Vaughn in court with attorney Christian T. Eichenlaub.  Defendant James M Vaughn in custody.  Francesco G Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 14, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
